description.narrative: On 22nd November 2010 a stampede on the bridge at Koh Pich Island in Phnom Penh during the city's water festival celebrations killed around 350 people, another approximate 400 people were injured, a mojority of those killed an injured were women. Following the disaster, Social Services of Cambodia (SSC) have recieved many requests to its counselling services from survivors, their family and friends and family of victims who are suffering from the sudden loss, the magnitude of the disaster and the trauma it involved. funding under this initiative provides emergency financial assistance to victims and their families affected by the stampede to assist them to obtain counselling services.
